results.title: Putting yourself together
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Guidance for the 70’s”.
Two teenagers and counsellor Daniel Whiteside take a close look at how to think your way past the put-downs or problems that often weaken your self-image. The give-and-take between the three, draws us into the film and challenges us all to start taking control of this part of our lives.

results.title: Production systems. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
The principles applied to commercial plant production are studied by the examination of three case studies. The first is pasture management, where with expert help, resources must be carefully managed to ensure the quality of diary produce. The second case study highlights broad-acre crops, a six year cycle of crop rotation and crop diversity to ensure better economic returns. Lastly, the focus turns to modern orchards and their design in order to ensure increased yields and good crop management.

results.title: Production systems. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Examines several different case studies on plant production systems. The environment can be manipulated to produce seedlings for retail nurseries, while vegetable seedlings are produced in large quantities needed by growers. Demonstrates hydroponics in a controlled environment being used to grow tomatoes and micro-propogating techniques. Explains how salt-tolerant plants can be cloned, using tissue culture methods to rapidly produce large numbers of plants suitable for use in high salinity areas.

group_works.title: Wonders sacred and mysterious
group_works.creator_credit: Marianne Gammon and Reader's Digest Association

results.title: Wonders sacred and mysterious
results.creator_credit: Marianne Gammon and Reader's Digest Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
Monuments of astonishing beauty and power such as Stonehenge, The Great Pyramids at Giza, Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, Borobudur in Java, St Peter’s Basilica in the Vatican City, and the Taj Mahal in Agra are all supreme examples of the human need to try and explain some of the mysteries of life, and the subject of this fascinating Reader’s Digest documentary.

results.title: Wonders of nature
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
All nature’s miracles evoke a sense of wonder but in some places nature reveals her magnificence in very special ways. Witness the majesty of the following places: The Grand Canyon - Arizona, USA ; The Serengeti - Kenya/Tanzania, Africa ; The Sahara Desert - Niger, West Africa ; Iguazu Falls - Argentina/Brazil, South America ; The Amazon River - Brazil, South America ; Ayers Rock (Uluru) - Australia ; The Himalayas - Nepal, Asia.

results.title: Ecosystems
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Growers face conflicting interests - the need to grow plants economically and the need to ensure against long-term destructive environmental consequences. Four case studies feature four different ecosystems: 1. Managing a National Park - preserving the natural features while allowing public access 2. Agro-forestry - the combination of timber production and agriculture 3. Parwan Valley - where a local Landcare group is working to restore the environmental balance 4. An Urban Bushland environment.

results.title: Wonders of man's creations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
When the urge to build conspires with a vision of beauty, man sometimes leaves behind an enduring mark. The following man-made marks are visited in this informative video: The Colosseum (Rome) ; Machu Pichu (Peru, South America) ; The Great Wall (China) ; The Kremlin (Russia) ; Versailles (France) ; The Statue of Liberty (New York city, USA) ; The Eiffel Tower (France) ; Mount Rushmore National Monument and Crazy Horse Monument (South Dakota, USA).

results.title: Establishing new plants
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Discusses how sexual reproduction, plant propagation and factors affecting plant growth are vital in establishing new plants for commercial production. Dormancy, the means by which a seed may survive in conditions where a plant may not, and different methods of seed scarification used to commence germination are also examined. Highlights methods of propagation including obtaining cuttings, grafting, budding and the use of rootstock.
